page.title: 08FRUIT FARM WORKER
page.content: My Dad gets up at 6am,has breakfast and briefly watches TV.At 7.10am he goes to work at the fruit farm,where we live.He begins by ploughing, spraying or picking.In the Summer at 8.30am the ladies arrive to pick strawberries,raspberries,apples and pears.My Dad drives the tractor with cages and bolt bins to collect the fruit.After a tea break at 10.30 he might spray unripe fruit or clean fruit by drenching.At 12 noon he stops for lunch,begining again at 1pm,when he loads lorries,then continues picking,spraying or ploughing.At the end of the afternoon,he collects the fruit which has been picked during the day.From 6 to 7pm he does some drenching.At 7pm he comes home,has tea and goes out gardening.At 10pm he comes back in and goes to bed. Royston Baker.
